paper_abstract: We study geometric properties of the solution variety for the problem of approximating solutions of systems of polynomial equations. We prove that given the two pairs (f (i) ,zeta (i) ), i=1,2, there exist a short path joining them such that the complexity of following the path is bounded by the logarithm of the condition number of the problems.
paper_title: Complexity of Bezout's Theorem VII: Distance Estimates in the Condition Metric
